title: `rclone config create` of Google Drive remote opens browser even when given service_account_credentials
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I am trying to do headless, unattended creation of a Google Drive remote. For that, I am trying to use the `service_account_credentials` Google Drive option. Note: for the examples below I have a file with the service account JSON blob, but for my actual use case `service_account_credentials` is way more convenient.

When I execute

```
rclone-beta config create google-drive drive service_account_credentials "$(cat $HOME/Downloads/creds.json)" shared_with_me true
```

rclone opens a browser and expects me to log in. This is unexpected. I would have expected it to quietly, and without requiring input, update the config file with the options. If I execute

```
rclone-beta config create google-drive drive service_account_file $HOME/Downloads/creds.json shared_with_me true
```

then it behaves as expected - no browser opened and it quietly updates the config file with the path to the file.

As a workaround, I can provide a dummy value for `service_account_file`, which seems to be ignored except for checking whether to open a browser window. For example:

```
rclone-beta config create google-drive drive service_account_credentials "$(cat $HOME/Downloads/creds.json)" shared_with_me true service_account_file no
```

I dug into the code a little, and it looks like a check around [here](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/94e34cb783af60c89e7928e8d0ab96377f33a98b/backend/drive/drive.go#L202) for non-empty `opt.ServiceAccountCredentials` may help.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
$ rclone-beta version
rclone v1.55.0-beta.5247.94e34cb78
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.16
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu Linux 20.04, 64-bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone-beta config create google-drive drive service_account_credentials "$(cat $HOME/Downloads/creds.json)" shared_with_me true
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

